articles.description: Tom Curry is set to win the competitive race to be the British and Irish Lions  open-side flanker ahead of Jac Morgan, with Sione Tuipulotu featuring in an all-Scotland midfield.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions: Tom Curry and Sione Tuipulotu set to start first Test

articles.description: As the Open Championship returns to Royal Portrush, those who saw Rory McIlroy shoot a record 61 around the course as a 16-year-old remember it as the day he went to "the next level" in his career.
articles.title: The Open 2025: 'McIlroy's got it going, you need to see this' - Rory's record 61 at Royal Portrush told by those who were there

articles.description: BBC Sport explores the issues around slow over-rates during the England-India Test series and looks at possible solutions.
articles.title: England vs India: How to solve Test cricket's slow over-rate problem

articles.description: Joe Root admits he was "panicking" during Ben Stokes' marathon bowling spells during the third-Test win against India but says they show the England captain "trusts his body".
articles.title: England v India: Ben Stokes' marathon bowling efforts show he trusts his body - Joe Root

articles.description: World number one Scottie Scheffler questions why he is continually chasing victories in the sport's biggest tournaments.

articles.description: Newcastle are exploring a move for Hugo Ekitike - but will the French striker play with Alexander Isak or replace him?

articles.description: Spain's Ministry of Social Rights asks the country's prosecutor's office to investigate Barcelona winger Lamine Yamal after he reportedly hired people with dwarfism to perform at his 18th birthday party.
articles.title: Lamine Yamal: Barcelona winger set to be investigated over dwarfism row
